reviews.productTitle: Legrand radiant RH453PTCCCV6 450W Preset Decorator Rocker Dimmer Light Switch with Locator Light for Dimmable LED and CFL Bulbs, Single Pole/3-Way, White/Light Almond/Ivory (1 Count)
reviews.text: Bought this one to replace one I had purchase a couple years ago. This one had good reviews and a higher wattage rating so I thought it might work better. At both high and low settings it flickers, not continuously but occasionally. On the middle setting it is less often but overall not pleased. The other rooms in the house with the same LED bulbs do not flicker at all so I know it is not the circuit or bulbs...must be the dimmer. Not another brand for me to try at the moment so I'm stuck. I do not recommend it.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2025
reviews.title: Not Pleased

reviews.text: My existing junction box is full of wires/nuts with little available space. I wanted to replace the existing switch (which had screw terminals) with same. Now days most switches have wires that you connect to wall wiring with wire nuts and ends up consuming a lot of space in box. This switch was one of few with screw terminals and worked perfectly for me. My only complaint is the switch is a little loosey-goosey (not as solid of a click). But other than that I'm very happy with it.

reviews.text: My builder installed a bunch of these, and I found they don't work well with certain bulbs. The recessed LEDs work great, but track lights did not. They were very dim and winked out when my printer was running. My electrician blamed the driver circuits in the no-name LED bulbs I got from Amazon. So I purchased some GE branded bulbs of the same wattage and put one in each circuit. Presto, all the bulbs, including the cheap ones, were bright and steady and the dimming worked perfectly.

reviews.productTitle: Legrand radiant RH453PTCCCV6 450W Preset Decorator Rocker Dimmer Light Switch with Locator Light for Dimmable LED and CFL Bulbs, Single Pole/3-Way, White/Light Almond/Ivory (1 Count)
reviews.text: Bought some Vanoopee dimmable LED track lights. Says to use TRiAC dimmer. Was not sure what that was. Turns out many modern ‘universal’ dimmers are usually TRIAC. I took a chance on this one and it worked perfectly right out of the box. Very well made device imo. I just swopped out my SP switch for this one. Worked as hoped. I did follow the directions regarding setting the low end of the dimmer. It was an easy adjustment. Only took two circuit shutoffs to get the full range of dimming of my Vanoopee lights. Very pleased with the product. Very pleased with the 10W Vanoopee 3 color dimmable integral LED track light heads too.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2023
reviews.title: Works great. Simple install.

reviews.productTitle: Legrand radiant RH453PTCCCV6 450W Preset Decorator Rocker Dimmer Light Switch with Locator Light for Dimmable LED and CFL Bulbs, Single Pole/3-Way, White/Light Almond/Ivory (1 Count)
reviews.text: I'm an industrial electrician. I installed these in a Media room at work to dim some can lights. Price was certainly reasonable for this type of switch. Dimmers can be touchy about LED lighting. Especially if your having trouble with regular fixtures and LED bulbs. These worked flawlessly. In fact, I want to install a dimmer switch over my Dining Room table. I chose this model for my own house and am expecting it's arrival today. I foresee no issues with this quality product. Be aware that there is an adjustment lever to achieve the perfect 'no flicker' level when installing. Fairly easy install if you follow directions. TURN OFF ALL POWER, and verify no voltage before install! SAFETY FIRST! Live another day to enjoy tomorrow's problems. :)
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2022
reviews.title: Works well with LED fixtures and bulbs

reviews.productTitle: Legrand radiant RH453PTCCCV6 450W Preset Decorator Rocker Dimmer Light Switch with Locator Light for Dimmable LED and CFL Bulbs, Single Pole/3-Way, White/Light Almond/Ivory (1 Count)
reviews.text: We are completing an extensive home renovation and purchased four of these switches for bathrooms and main living areas. First, do not purchase open box here because those didn’t work at all. Second, the dimmer in the bathroom attached to one sconce with three LED bulbs works well. However, when we used the switch for recessed lighting in the living room (hairy eight 15 watt LEDs) it flickered and buzzed like crazy at all levels of dimming. We switched it out for a Lutron dimmer switch which interestingly is actually rated for lower wattage (150 watt vs the 450 Legrand advertises) and it performed flawlessly. It’ll be Lutron for us from here on out I guess.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2022
reviews.title: Does not perform

reviews.text: I chose this for my parents in their 60s. Our dimmers have a much smaller dimmer toggle and it can be a pain to manage at 35... This one is just perfect. I am fussy and didn't want something cheap or overwhelming, like an oversize toggle. In our world lights only need a minimal adjustment on occasion. This is the perfect balance. There is one small LED which may not be enjoyed in your bedroom (it is the smallest one I have seen yet however) Overall, this paddle has a crisp actuation and feels quality.

reviews.productTitle: Legrand radiant RH453PTCCCV6 450W Preset Decorator Rocker Dimmer Light Switch with Locator Light for Dimmable LED and CFL Bulbs, Single Pole/3-Way, White/Light Almond/Ivory (1 Count)
reviews.text: This switch looks great, matches other Legrand switches well, and I love the slider for the dimmer. Sure, a slider might look lower tech than a button with a revolving light, but I can quickly set the brightness exactly where I want it without cycling through different levels of brightness. I would estimate the brightness goes from about 30-40% to 100%, so with super bright bulbs it doesn't get that dim, but it's still very noticeably brighter at the high end and comfortably dim at the low end and I could always get dimmer bulbs if I wanted more wiggle room on the dim end. There is zero flickering with led bulbs.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2022
reviews.title: Perfect in every way

reviews.text: Installed these for use with brand new Globe Electric Ultra Slim LED recessed lighting and they immediately caused issues with flickering. If you dim both sets of lights they flicker terribly at the lowest setting. Wound up going with Leviton dimmer switches and it solved all my flickering issues.

reviews.productTitle: Legrand radiant RH453PTCCCV6 450W Preset Decorator Rocker Dimmer Light Switch with Locator Light for Dimmable LED and CFL Bulbs, Single Pole/3-Way, White/Light Almond/Ivory (1 Count)
reviews.text: The look and feel of this is just overall nicer than Lutron's competing decorator dimmer. I really appreciate the matte look and feel - it's less prone to scratching and scuffing and looks a lot nicer than the high gloss options from competitors. Lutron decorator dimmers have wires that protrude from them and require you to use wire nuts to join them with the wiring in your electrical boxes. These, however, have the standard screw terminals that allow for not only the standard J-hook, but also for back-wiring (back, not push-in, which is inferior). The back wiring makes it really easy to quickly and securely replace a lot of switches in a short time frame. The little light on the switch that turns on when the switch is off is also fantastic - it's bright enough to see in the dark, but not bright enough to be an eyesore or call attention to itself. What's the catch? Unfortunately, it seems that this switch has a hard time with LEDs. I tried installing in two different places with different fixtures and bulbs. Despite adjusting the minimum dimming setting on the switch (which is not as easy to adjust as Lutron's), one set of dimmable bulbs would not dim at all. The other barely had any dimmable range and buzzed loudly at all settings. Ripped these out and replaced them with the Lutron switches that had a much better dimming range and didn't cause lights to buzz.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2021
reviews.title: Easy to install with great wiring options, but doesn't work with LEDs

reviews.productTitle: Legrand radiant RH453PTCCCV6 450W Preset Decorator Rocker Dimmer Light Switch with Locator Light for Dimmable LED and CFL Bulbs, Single Pole/3-Way, White/Light Almond/Ivory (1 Count)
reviews.text: Hard pressed to find a better dimmer of higher quality with such broadness of compatibilities. Never met an LED or other that didn’t work. Cheaper brands fail with weird LED watt levels or create a flicker on bulbs at the dimmest setting. Nothing more to say but the brand is top tier vs standard builder grade switches. Worth the extra few dollars since switches last so long I cannot imagine how people lived before illuminated switches…. Truly the dark ages
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2021
reviews.title: Brand is quality

reviews.text: These are not compatible with LED lights. I purchased 23 of these for my house. Five different types of light fixtures. Each and every one flickers.

reviews.productTitle: Legrand radiant RH453PTCCCV6 450W Preset Decorator Rocker Dimmer Light Switch with Locator Light for Dimmable LED and CFL Bulbs, Single Pole/3-Way, White/Light Almond/Ivory (1 Count)
reviews.text: Unlike less expensive dimmers, these have a calibration setting to set the minimum brightness of your lights. At minimum setting of the slider, your lights should not be all the way off, that's what the on-off switch is for. The calibration adjustment can prevent lights from going out completely when the dimmer is at minimum setting. That's a very nice feature, in my opinion. The instructions tell you not to make calibration adjustments with the power on. I would heed that advice.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2021
reviews.title: Able To Set Minimum Brightness - Nice!

reviews.text: Doesn't get as bright a it should. I have 2 small pendants it controls and the original switch was better because it allowed all the brightness that it supposed to show. This dimmer was supposed to give that same brightness option but it just doesn't and it clitches at the highest brightness so we can't even turn it up all the wall. In the picture, the pendants are turned off and the dimmer is not used to take the picture.

reviews.productTitle: Legrand radiant RH453PTCCCV6 450W Preset Decorator Rocker Dimmer Light Switch with Locator Light for Dimmable LED and CFL Bulbs, Single Pole/3-Way, White/Light Almond/Ivory (1 Count)
reviews.text: Reading the reviews, the pattern is clear. This switch just doesn't seem to cut it when it comes to dimmable LED bulbs. No matter how many different (dimmable) LED bulbs I installed, I experienced occasional flickering as well as times where I would turn on the switch and the bulbs would dimly light, although the dimmer was turned all the way up. The problem would solve itself by switching the light off, and then back on again. I tried adjusting the wheel on the side to no avail as the problems mentioned above continued. I replaced the switch with the simple GE dimmer and all problems went away. I packaged this one up and sent it back for a refund.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2021
reviews.title: No good with LED's
